basics.name: Robin Newhouse
basics.label: PhD Candidate working with the ATLAS experiment at CERN
basics.summary:
Hi! I'm Robin. I'm A PhD candidate in experimental particle physics at the University of British Columbia and working with CERN's Large Hadron Collider. I've also got a BSc in Astrophysics, with a minor in Computer Science. I'm particularly interested in machine learning, data science, and scientific software engineering. I have years of experience extracting quantitative insights from enormous datasets. 
 
I'm personable, enthusiastic, and driven to identify and solve problems. My key experience is in data science, machine learning, object-oriented programming, scientific computing, high-energy physics, grid computing, and automated data pipelines. 
 
I look forward to expanding my skills in intelligent automation, cloud platforms, and ML applications in business environments. Ideally, I'd love to use my skills to solve the pressing tasks of stabilizing our environment and advancing renewable energy. 
 
Let's talk about how I can contribute to your organization!

publications.name: Open XAL Status Report
publications.summary:
Abstract 
Open XAL is an accelerator physics software platform developed in collaboration among several facilities around the world. The Open XAL collaboration was formed in 2010 to port, improve and extend the successful XAL platform used at the Spallation Neutron Source for use in the broader accelerator community and to establish it as the standard platform for accelerator physics software. The site-independent core is complete, active applications have been ported, and now we are in the 
process of verification and transitioning to using Open XAL in production. This paper will present the current status and a roadmap for this project.
